page.title: 10 KETTERING PARISH CHURCH
page.content: The Parish Church of S.S. Peter and Paul was built around 1350 and overlooks the Market Place.Three services are held on a Sunday and one each day. The twelve bells are rung at every service. Above the North Porch there is a tiny room where the Priest used to rest. The church contains many artifacts from the past. A 16th century chest contains documents and registers which were stored in the church for safe keeping and were never claimed. There is also a 17th century book desk with chains for two books. The Victorian West Window is in memory of Canon Lindsay who built St. Andrew's School. There are also windows depicting the life of Mary the mother of Jesus and a modern window depicting St. Crispin and St. Crispian, patron saints of shoemaking.
